meanings.definition: To remove the skin from (an animal or fruit)
meanings.sent1: She carefully skinned the apple before eating it.
meanings.sent2: The chef skinned the fish before cooking it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally skinned the banana while trying to peel it quickly.
meanings.sent4: The hunter skillfully skinned the deer after the successful hunt.
meanings.sent5: The butcher's hands were stained red as he skinned the chicken.

meanings.definition: Having skin of a specified kind or number of layers
meanings.sent1: The snake had a shiny, green-skinned body.
meanings.sent2: The lizard's rough-skinned texture helped it blend into the environment.
meanings.sent3: The skinned frog looked quite different from its slimy companions.
meanings.sent4: The skinned peach felt soft and fuzzy to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The skinned potato had a brown, earthy skin.

meanings.definition: To injure the surface of (something) by rubbing against something rough
meanings.sent1: She accidentally skinned her knee while falling off the bike.
meanings.sent2: The cat skinned the furniture by scratching it repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: He playfully skinned the basketball against the rough pavement.
meanings.sent4: The rough edges of the table skinned the delicate fabric of her dress.
meanings.sent5: The old book was skinned along the edges from years of use.
